attributes.action: Raise the speed limit of the motorway to unlimited
attributes.background: In Germany I realized how efficient and well maintained the highways were and how advanced the "Autobahns" are similar to the "smart" motorways we have in the UK. I believe we should have a system in place where in certain areas of the motorway it should have an unrestricted speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: 6% of deaths occur on British motorways and 40% in urban roads. a further 54% of deaths occur on rural roads. compared with Germany their motorway deaths stand at 12%, 60% on rural roads and 28% in urban areas. I believe we should use the same system where we can adjust the speed limit to the road conditions using the smart motorways (such as limiting the motorway to 70mph in wet conditions etc) and introducing unlimited speed limits in quiet times such as 9pm-8am. This would allow less accidents down rural roads as there is a safer place to speed (as shown by statistics)

attributes.action: Review the way the Department of Work and Pensions treats mentally ill claimants
attributes.background: I am doing this on behalf of a friend who has suffered with long term depression and has been treated appallingly by the DWP. I am concerned that this is not a one-off case and that there are a lot of vulnerable people who are being treated in such an irresponsible and dangerous manner.

attributes.action: Amend the Equality Act (2010) to include all gender identities and expressions
attributes.background: The Equality Act (2010) made important strides when it included making it unlawful to discriminate against transsexuals. However this excludes all other gender identities that fall under the Transgender umbrella, therefore taking away their freedom to be themselves for fear of persecution.

attributes.action: Maintain Freedom of Movement within EU countries that currently have the Euro.
attributes.background: As most countries with the Euro have economies similar to our own I feel this would help reduce low-skilled immigration while maintaining freedoms for those UK citizens who wish to live and work in Europe. I believe this would represent both sides of the recent referendum vote.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.migrationwatchuk.org/statistics-net-migration-statistics

As you will see from the link more people entered the UK from Non-EU countries 277,000 than EU countries 270,000. If you select the EU8 and EU2 options you see that the countries without the Euro make up 160,000 of the total amount of EU immigration. Therefore negotiating a situation that maintains Free Movement of Workers with countries that have the Euro will still allow a more than 50% reduction of uncontrolled EU immigration and yet maintain opportunities in the majority of Europe for UK citizens.

attributes.action: Prime Minister suspend 3rd Heathrow runway until Brexit negotiations complete
attributes.background:
Economic case for 3rd runway Heathrow can't be justified until all Brexit negotiations complete & or 2nd referendum.
Under Brexit if carried out, London may no longer retain hub status. If Scotland negotiates to remain in EU, strong economic case Edinburgh & Glasgow become future gateways to Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Assumptions of Heathrow expansion economic projections are based on London being at focal point of connection between UK & other European countries. Logic may now not hold true.
Until full scale of Brexit negotiations are known economic case for 3rd Heathrow runway is tenuous.
If after Brexit negotiations on UK leaving EU, Scotland negotiates to remain part of EU, perfectly conceivable Edinburgh & Glasgow could become significant economic hubs in their own right. Less need for Heathrow expansion

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number on contact.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number when contacting people. This will give people the chance to call bar nuisance callers directly from home and hopefully bring a stop to the constantly ringing telephone and recorded messages.

attributes.action: RSPCA vehicles to have some type of emergency lighting
attributes.background: RSPCA vehicles need to have some type of emergency lighting because pets mean the world to someone like everyone else, and animals need help quickly too and they can't get to places during rush hour traffic so its life or death for an animal

attributes.action: Make all anti-depressants free on the NHS
attributes.background: Anti-depressant tablets are needed by a large proportion of the U.K population - why should people have to pay for these when they desperately need them. Mental illnesses should be treated the same way as physical: in the way that for example Thyroid tablets are free, anti-depressants should be.

attributes.action: Make St George's day a public holiday.
attributes.background: Theresa May's first act as Prime Minister should be to make St George's day a public holiday thereby uniting all of England through patriotism as well as helping to boost the British Economy.

attributes.action: Sue the EU via the ECJ for the monies the UK should of had under our old rebate
attributes.background: In 2005, Blair gave up 40% of the UK rebate in return for future reforms of the EU. Since those reforms were never made - we should be refunded the money. Full transcripts of those meetings should be made public to ensure the EU did not persuade blair by offering him help with an EU presidency bid
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/6516753/Tony-Blairs-decision-to-cut-the-EU-rebate-cost-9.3billion-report-shows.html

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://forbritain.org/140518_eu_rebate_blair.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwjph9Wk7OfNAhVkJcAKHaF9Cd8QFggjMAI&usg=AFQjCNFmtmQSYDDg_kKTb48fcQY19PZ5ow&sig2=WGvOnpdL7aT0BjfKUkL4zw

attributes.action: We have no right to light. I think people should be entitled to light
attributes.background: I recently asked the local council to cut some trees that block daylight on my property and disabled neighbours nextdoor. I was advised I have no right to light and the law states this.

attributes.action: Procure the Government to adopt Geraint Davies's private member's Bill.
attributes.background:
Many false and misleading claims were made during the campaign which deceived people who were not able to judge the issues dispassionately. 
These gross misrepresentations at the very least justify a second referendum to determine whether the result is truly the settled will of the people.
attributes.additional_details:
37% of the eligible electorate voted to leave, which means that 63% did not.
Many quite simply were duped into believing extravagant promises which were unachievable, and on which the polititians concerned backtracked afterwards.
Referenda are not binding. 
The sheer magnitude of the consequences already being felt is too great to allow the fundamentally flawed result to be implemented without at the very least clarification of the settled will of the people, or a free vote in both Houses.

attributes.action: Change the way political parties are funded.
attributes.background: Political Parties should be funded from tax revenues only. There should be heavy financial penalties for Parties which renege on manifesto commitments; “fail to mention” major policies in their manifesto which they then implement.
attributes.additional_details: Such funding would help achieve a 'level playing field' for all parties and the removal of rich backers with vested interests and agendas. Financial penalties would help clean up campaigning prior to elections and restore a degree of trust in politicians and the system.

attributes.action: Completely Scrap Stamp Duty, we pay enough taxes!
attributes.background: Stamp Duty should be scraped, we pay enough already in taxes and scraping Stamp Duty will help people to afford to buy a property

attributes.action: Giving food brought to concerts to homeless so that none goes to waste.
attributes.background: Having recently changed my eating habits and diet that I was going to take some oats and dried fruit at a concert to enjoy as I hoped to sneak them through, in retrospect this was silly but I was still appalled that they simply threw it away despite everything I had being perfectly edible!

attributes.action: Pull our troops out of any provocative acts towards Russia.
attributes.background: To anyone with a little knowledge it is easy to see that the US and UK governmentso are trying to provoke Russia with extremely dangerous and hostile acts, including the strategic placement of missile systems.  We the people DO NOT want a war with Russia.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has sent troops to the Russian border.

attributes.action: Negotiate personal EU membership for certain categories of UK citizen.
attributes.background: Citizens with either: 1. A spouse with EU citizenship; or 2. Pension rights in an EU member state; have had their European homeland taken from them and their family lives crippled. Personal EU membership confirmed by an official passport endorsement would help to mitigate that injustice.
attributes.additional_details:
Under Personal Membership of the EU, eligible individuals would benefit from Non-discrimination and Citizenship of the Union as described in Part Two of the Consolidated Treaties and Charter of Fundamental Rights, Articles 18–25.
http://europa.eu/pol/pdf/consolidated-treaties_en.pdf#page=57

attributes.action: Make it so you do not have to declare none fault accidents on motor insurance
attributes.background: Why are people been penalised for something they didn't cause or do motor insurance goes up for thous who had a accident that wasn't their fault and it shouldn't no longer be aloud to happen we should have to tell the insurance company for accident that are none fault

attributes.action: Provide bursaries for mental health training
attributes.background: Psychotherapy and counselling training is lengthy and expensive. Mental health is crying out for more trained professionals. I would like to see incentivised grants to help attract more people to the profession, and to help those attracted, but without the funds to study.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has a teacher shortage. As a result, the Government introduced incentivised bursaries to attract more people to train as teachers. The mental health profession has an even bigger shortage, yet training is both lengthy and very expensive. If we are to help deal with the deficit of appointments and patients on waiting lists, then access to training needs is a necessity.

Please support this important campaign to help provide more professionals in such an underresourced sector.

attributes.action: no income tax on overtime for people who earn £9 per hour or less
attributes.background: many people on low wages find them self having to work over time to make ends meet, so I'm asking that people on a low wage (£9 per hour or less) should not be taxed on over time that they need just to get by each month

attributes.action: Stop the bidding and banding system for new council/housing associations
attributes.background: This is for a better housing allocations as the bidding and banding system does not work for a lot of people and are left living in a place there not happy and doesn't meet the needs for the family
attributes.additional_details: I have been living i n a poky 2 bed ground floor flat for 5years and is not suitable for us as my child has hardly any space and bidding does not get us any where something seriously need to change please sign this petition to get a chance to get what we all need and deserve

attributes.action: Lower the age of sexual consent to 14 if both parties are under 16
attributes.background: I would like action on this petition because I feel that sexual consent laws are outdated. I feel as if sexual consent should be legal (if both under 16 and over 14)  like a "Romeo and Juliet" Law like they have in other countries. I think this would help teenagers feel better about sexual consent.

attributes.action: Fund our NHS with an additional £3billion per annum using former EU finances
attributes.background: Our national health service is wavering under the weight of increased expectations and lack of funding. This petition would like to see that NHS staff are paid and treated fairly, compensated properly for any work related illness and supported through any work related illness as may be necessary.
attributes.additional_details: In addition to this there are an increased number of reports of missing medical records that are needed to claim work related illness compensation. The funds should be drawn from the savings of leaving the EU as suggested by the leave campaign. Such insinuations have been recognised in hindsight as a significant influence on the voting of the British public and many feel that the retraction of that notion is unjust.

attributes.action: Make MPs promise to protect certain EU legislation, including workers' rights.
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of the EU. As has been pointed out numerous times it is bureaucratic and its organisation has many flaws. That said I voted to remain because being a member has made the UK a better, fairer country. I fear this being undone and the country going backwards, not forwards.
attributes.additional_details:
17,410,742 people voted to leave the EU in the referendum, but 16,141,241 voted to stay. If slightly over 630,000 had voted differently the remain campaign would have won the vote. Though the wishes of the majority must be accepted, it would be intolerable to ignore the wishes of the remain voters.

If the UK wishes to be an outward looking nation then a public statement must be made by MPs from all parties that EU legislation regarding workers' rights and the environment will be protected.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on lowering income tax to 5% for earnings below £80k per annum
attributes.background:
Following the EU referendum, we have come to understand that the will of the people is absolute. Even when it is contradictory to expert advice, based on a foundation of lies and damaging for services vital to both the people and the economy.

We now call for similar action regarding income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
A reduction in income tax will give back control of finances to the British public to spend on whatever they deem is appropriate for the good of the country. This is reflective of the position on our EU membership.

This would ensure that local communities are supported through a boost to spending and that the public as a whole will be happier.

We believe that this petition is in the interests of the majority of the population and that a referendum would be appropriate.

Thank you.

attributes.action: Make businesses refund as fast as they debt you
attributes.background: It's very annoying that companies can debt you immediately for purchases but are unable to refund you up to 5 working days. This needs to be changed to immediate.

attributes.action: Religious holidays should not affect your attendance at educational institutes
attributes.background: Those in educational establishments should be afforded a day off for a major religious festival (eg; Eid, Diwali) without this going against their attendance percentage. 100% attendance should still be achievable in these circumstances.

attributes.action: Make non-payment of rent a criminal offence
attributes.background: Landlords need protection from unscrupulous people who refuse to pay their rent knowing the law is in favour of the tenant. Not only will they  continue to live rent free sometimes for up to a year but they will often trash the property rendering it uninhabitable and then move doing the same again.
attributes.additional_details: Unscrupulous tenants deliberately fail to pay their rent knowing that the legal processes of eviction are long and tedious,They take advantage of this often causing serious damage to a property while the landlord is waiting for legal processes to take effect. These types often cause conflict with neighbours and no-one can take them to task over it. When they are eventually evicted they repeat the process elsewhere  without paying a penny towards their debt or being held accountable for damage.

attributes.action: For MPs to stop referring to each other as "honourable".
attributes.background: The EU referendum has shown that several MPs are quite happy to knowingly mislead the general public with untruths so the House Of Commons address of "my honourable friend" or "honourable lady/gentleman" is wholly inappropriate. Just referring to each other as "the MP for" would be correct.

attributes.action: Promise to match EU spending within the UK in the event of Brexit.
attributes.background: A large part of the campaign to leave the EU was based on the fact that the UK is a net contributor to the EU funds. We contribute £12.9bn a year (gross) or £7.1bn a year (net). In the event of Brexit, we would ask the government to maintain the level of investment in the UK that the EU contributed.
attributes.additional_details: The EU contributed £5.2bn a year to the UK, by various mechanisms. Given that in the event of Britain leaving the EU we will not be paying membership fees, we would ask that the government promise to maintain the payments that would have been made by the EU. This will, for example, protect vulnerable areas of the UK by matching the funding they would have received from the European development fund.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Payments applied to a Card that is regularly reviewed.
attributes.background: Child Maintenance Visa Cards would ensure that the hard earned cash is being spent on the child and not the mother. Accounts should be reviewed every quarter and receipts should need to be submitted monthly to confirm what had been spent. A app that lets you scan the receipts would keep things easy.
attributes.additional_details: Fathers who pay child maintenance for children should be allowed to see that their hard earned money is actually being spent on supporting the child, instead it is seen as a position of power and a way to undermine the father, the idea is to provide mothers with a card that can be monitored to ensure the money is being spent correctly, for example say there's £300 on the card and only £100 is spent that month the £200 left over should be put into a savings account for the child's 18th birthday?

attributes.action: A General election before October and summer recess in parliament cancelled?
attributes.background:
1. For there to be a change in the law with immediate effect to enable a general election.
2. For parliamentary summer recess to be cancelled to enable resolution of Brexit.
3. A change in the law to separate financial services from electoral register to enable all and the young to vote.
attributes.additional_details: The 1st two articles in this are very much self explanatory, however article 3' is specifically designed to ensure those who due to debt collectors having access to the electoral registration system, so can track those poor people down who were victims of the GEC, can finally clear house in parliament and punish those responsible and not the immigrants blamed for the countries mess.  Also article 3' will see the law change to make it easy for the UK's young to vote by allowing temp registration.

attributes.action: To stop the right to roam and bring in a trespassing law into Scotland
attributes.background: Privately owned property should have the right to refuse anyone the right to walk on their land

attributes.action: Put an end to the driving theory process.
attributes.background: The driving theory test that is required in the UK is a complete nonsense. It wasn't deemed necessary in former years and it shouldn't be relevant now. Why should a memory test dictate whether you are suitable to drive? It is simply a money making scheme, which is highly unfair on young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Problems:
- Memory based.
- Favours those who prefer exams conditions.
- It keeps competent young drivers off the roads.
- It drains the money of millions of young people
- It wasn't deemed important years ago so why is it important now?

attributes.action: Make unsecured debt remedies available for child support arrears.
attributes.background: According to Gingerbread, the CSA has left almost £4bn of outstanding arrears, with the DWP’s estimating only £467m is ever likely to be recovered.
attributes.additional_details: According to Gingerbread's latest report, www.gingerbread.org.uk/content/2297/Missing-maintenance nearly half of single-parent families live below the poverty line and the number is increasing. Although the CMS charges for collection, it has only recovered 53% due (leaving£52.5m arrears) and less than half the eligible children getting anything. Its collection remedies are insufficient, particularly for the large number of self-employed/cash- in- hand owing parents.

attributes.action: N.u.t striking should be illegal....
attributes.background: they have 91.7% wanting to strike with only a 24.7% overall turnout so the minority of disruptive teachers cause chaos across the country
attributes.additional_details: N.u.t claim that this is partly due to school funding which I find staggering as every child at our primary school has use of an iPad for example. regarding hours worked is also ridiculous it is well known that teachers get more annual leave than any other proffesion so to quote a 60 hour week is proposer oust if they calculated there hours worked over a year it would be significantly less than the average worker doing between 40 and 60 hours a week with only 20 days leave

attributes.action: To remove the copyright laws in communal rooms in sheltered housing .
attributes.background: if you live in a sheltered housing building , and want to watch a video / dvd in the communal room with other residents you have to pay a copyright fee of over £400 a year these people are all over 75 all have tv licences for there flats so why should they have to pay to watch in the communal room .
attributes.additional_details: Stop robbing the retired ,  old aged person and start giving a little back .

attributes.action: Start working on a drive through tunnel for the Isle of Wight to help the locals
attributes.background: A fixed link drive through tunnel will help the locals, businesses, tourism and the economy of the Island and stop the ferry companies over pricing  the poor and slow service plus it will create employment and boost the Island as a great holiday destination for many many years to come.

attributes.action: Government to hold a referendum by 22 June 2018 on joining the European Union
attributes.background: People who previously advocated leaving the EU had their voice heard in a call for a referendum. In fairness, -but also in terms of observing democratic principles-, the people who (now) advocate to join the EU should also have their voice heard in their call for a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned, ask this Government (or its successive Government) to hold a referendum by 22 June 2018, on joining the European Union, asking the people of the United Kingdom to choose between the following two options: ‘Join the EU’ or ‘Remain out of the EU’.

attributes.action: make a new law to force landlords to allow pets in rented properties
attributes.background: all pets deserve a loving home and this is being taken away by landlords refusing to allow pets so I ask all animal lovers to support this and get the government to make a new law forcing landlords to allow pets in rented properties

attributes.action: Stop bonfires, during the hours of daylight, in residential areas.
attributes.background: I live in an area with large gardens but neighbours frequently have bonfires during daylight hours. Smoke never blows into their garden! Gardens should be enjoyed and relaxing but this is impossible with smoke making you choke. If they waited until after dark, then no-one would be affected by it.

attributes.action: Change Education Sector Staff Holidays to normal annual leave arrangements.
attributes.background: As this is paid for through public moneys including full pay through 7 or 8 weeks summer holidays this should be modernised to a annual leave policy in line with modern practices. The pupil breaks could see local and national improvement groups for education or indeed local school policy works.

attributes.action: Ensure level 3 BTEC's are not equivelant to 3 A levels
attributes.background: According to the board of education, a Level 3 BTEC is equivelent to 3 A- levels. However the amount of work, stress, perserverance and time spent completing A levels is far from on par with that endured from BTEC students.
attributes.additional_details:
'Even students who win places at prestigious Russell Group universities on the back of top results in BTECs are much less likely to gain a first or 2:1 and more than 40 per cent fail to complete their degree course, with many withdrawing because of “academic failure”.'- The Sunday Times.
A- Level students are experienced with high levels of stress and mental endurance due to the courses sat, and so is it just they have to compete for university places that will most probably be dropped out of?

attributes.action: Greater taxation on the tabloid press for mis informing the population on Brexit
attributes.background: It is the tabloid press that have been responsible for mis informing the public regarding Brexit.  Their xenophobic views are polluting the minds of the majority of the population. The economy will suffer as a result of this, therefore this is a way of supporting the British economy
attributes.additional_details: Their continued barracking of the England team selection, resulted in the wrong team being selected by Roy Hodgson.  This was the sole reason England failed to beat Iceland.  Evidence is the bilge they have printed for the last 6 months, which is resulting in minorities of the population being targeted across the country.  Reference all the Murdoch press and other tabloid toilet paper

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit for vans below 7.5ton to the same as cars on a A road
attributes.background:
I've been a van driver for as long as I can remember.
And it just seems mad that a van has to do 50mph on a A road .
When vans this day and age are more safer  than most car's.
Cause more accidents as cars can do 60mph and get impatient and do dangerous overtaking.

attributes.action: Defer any action to leave European Union for three year or until next Election.
attributes.background: Britain has just voted to leave European Union. The process will not start until notice under article 50 is given to EU. Britain should take its own time before giving such notice and in the meanwhile try to obtain reforms such as on immigration and benefits before starting the leave process.
attributes.additional_details: EU wants Britain to leave quickly and want to make this process as a difficult divorce. Britain does not need to rush and should take time before even tendering the notice to leave and making efforts to bring reforms. This is in EU interest as well.

attributes.action: Hold a post referendum opinion poll on key factors before the exit negotiations.
attributes.background: Public opinion and information have been misrepresented in a highly complex question. Public opinion of key facts (Immigration, Economy, Politics, etc.) should be found before any exit negotiations can take place, to ensure accurate and fair representation of the true feelings of the population.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence of misinterpretation of facts has been shown by those leading the campaigns. Public information and opinion has also been shown to be misinformed, given social media trends (i.e #Regretzit) and search engine results (i.e. What is the EU? / What are the results of leaving the EU?) taking place post the referendum result.

A full and open opinion poll should be carried out to find a better understanding of UK opinion on a wider number of topics involved in the exit debate.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from using both lanes on the 2 lane carriageway A1m,To stop congestion
attributes.background: There is chronic delays on the 2 carriageway A1m by HGV's overtaking HGV's forcing all traffic to 40-50 mph which leads to stood traffic at five lane ends & ferrybridge

attributes.action: Allow students aged 16+ whose parents receive financial aid to gain employment.
attributes.background: Students who's parents receive financial aid from the governments benefits system should be allowed to gain employment as they currently are not. If a parent or career receives benefits then the house hold income must stay the same to what is provided by the government.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing students to gain employment it allows them to learn financial sustainability and also gives them vital work experience which is widely needed to gain future employment. I am a 17 year old student who has to volunteer to use up spare time as I cant gain employment. I would like to earn my own money but cant due to legal reasons. Even if I could only earn a certain amount would be better than none. So please help me with this petition and sign and share to gain work rights for students

attributes.action: Consider independent representatives in all future referendum campaigns.
attributes.background: For all future referendum campaigns, we would like to see the appointment of independent and impartial representatives debate both sides of the argument (with the budget split evenly).  We feel that by doing this, each sides argument is based on fact and not for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been set up in the wake of the European referendum whereby both sides of the debate contained large degrees of scaremongering and, retrospectively it would appear a number of false statements.

We feel that the clear choice in a democratic society is for independent (non-political) representatives to debate both sides in future (based on facts) and with no bias.
